sentences.sContent: They toasted the birth of their new baby with champagne.
sentences.sCn: 他们用香槟酒庆贺自己孩子的出生。

sentences.sContent: I had a piece of toast for breakfast
I’d like to propose a toast (= ask people to drink a toast ) to the bride and groom.
sentences.sCn: 我提议为新郎新娘干杯。

phrases.pCn: 祝酒，敬酒；做一片土司面包

words.tran: 烤面包器，烤箱；祝酒人；烤面包的人
宴会主持人，主持人；致敬酒辞者，祝酒提议人

trans.tranOther: to drink a glass of wine etc to thank some-one, wish someone luck, or celebrate something

trans.tranCn: 烤面包（片）；吐司面包；干杯
trans.tranOther: bread that has been heated so that it is brown on both sides and no longer soft
